item.title: Research
item.description: Research I am currently working on unveiling ecological mechanisms that facilitate the long-term stability of metapopulations. In particular, I want to know how organisms respond and adapt to changes in the environment and how these responses subsequently affect ecological network dynamics. Research projects I am currently a member of the consortium regarding the HFSP Project on organism response to perturbations. Within the context of the project, I will be focusing on modeling the population dynamics of microbiomes under perturbations.

item.title: Publications
item.description: List of publications >> note: my name is highlighted in bold. Journal articles Johannes Nauta, Pieter Simoens, Yara Khaluf and Ricardo Martinez-Garcia. "Foraging behavior and patch size distribution jointly determine population dynamics in fragmented landscapes". Journal of The Royal Society Interface 19.191 (2022). Johannes Nauta, Pieter Simoens, and Yara Khaluf. "Group size and resource fractality drive multimodal search strategies: A quantitative analysis on group foraging". Physica A: Statistical Mechanics and its Applications 590, 126702 (2022).
